column1: In New York State Rifle & Pistol Association, Inc. v. Bruen, will the Supreme Court rule that New York State's denial of applications for concealed-carry licenses for self-defense violated the Second Amendment?
column6: ['Society', 'US Policy']
DONE. https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/national-international/supreme-court-rules-against-new-yorks-gun-permit-law/3746400/

The case is intersting , it assumes that self-defense is a de facto right, when it is not compiled in the constitution of the US as the originalist idea of interpretaions gets tossed around, in many prior cases the supreme court has not considered self-defense a right. Some logic here, as it is ready to issue the abortion opinion, using the same oroginalist logic; an individual self-defense right pressumes the risk of constant harm, if the persue of happiness is a right, then having a kid by some individuals might be considered unhappiness, will the same originalist logic apply, might view is that it is all a bunch of hypocrisy on steroids.

In the opinion of the august Supremes majority, there are still too many of us New Yorkers. We are well known to be a threat to Justice, domestic Tranquility, the common defense, the general Welfare, and the Blessings of Liberty. Letting us bang away at each other even more easily should help to reduce the menace.

Hard for me to envision basic sanity (e.g.: https://www.mass.gov/news/ag-healey-urges-supreme-court-to-uphold-the-right-of-state-and-local-governments-to-regulate-the-public-carry-of-firearms) prevailing right now on matters about individuals and guns in the U.S. -- perhaps especially (for this question) given the current make-up of the Supreme Court.
SCOTUS is a vassal to the GOP/NRA & has been assembled to advance such objectives. 5-4 at best.

This case hinges upon the conservative bent of the court justices that makes up the Supreme Court. Trump appointed three conservative justices, Neil Gorsuch, Brett Kavanaugh and Amy Coney Barrett that gives the conservatives a 6-3 advantage. Barrett, as a judge on a Chicago- based federal appeals court in 2019 wrote a dissenting opinion that ‘legislatures have the power to prohibit dangerous people from possessing guns, but that power extends only to people who are dangerous.’ This is perhaps an indication as to she may vote on this case. The opinion is that Barrett will join her fellow conservatives in extending the right to bear arms out of the home into the public sphere. Justice Brett Kavanaugh recommended ‘that the justices take up another Second Amendment case soon, suggesting the lower courts might not be properly applying the Supreme Court's earlier gun rights rulings. Kavanaugh, during his tenure on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, dissented from that court's gun rights ruling, which upheld a ban on military-style, semiautomatic weapons and high-capacity ammunition magazines.’ A concealed carry weapon (CCW) is permitted in New York within your own property (Castle Doctrine), but this case is an attempt to allow it beyond these boundaries. Given the previous opinions of two of the conservative justices and the conservative majority (6-3) of the Supreme court, it is conceivable that they will agree that NY’s denial of concealed-carry licences violates the second amendment. Perhaps proof of a necessary self-defence requirement maybe a loophole.

The Court seems to be trying to avoid substantially altering the current precedents. This case, which they accepted after instructing the parties to "brief a slightly narrower question than the challengers had asked them to decide, limiting the issue to whether the state’s denial of the individuals’ applications to carry a gun outside the home for self-defense violated the Second Amendment." (Scotusblog) Casey says that states may impose some restrictions. Very tough call and Chief Justice Roberts will almost certainly be the swing vote.
